name: Carolina Fish Cakes
author: Becky Wergers
summary: These fish cakes are great with tartar or cocktail sauce or a simple squeeze of fresh lemon or lime.  For a change of pace add a bit of chili powder, cilantro and jalapeno or a teaspoon of Cajun spice. Nice served with boiled red potatoes and a spinach salad. This recipe has two cooking options: you can fry the cakes or bake them -- it's up to you!
ingredients: ⅓ cup chopped green bell pepper
⅓ cup red bell pepper, chopped
3 ½ cups cooked cod, boned and flaked
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Bring 3 cups of water to a boil
Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes
Reserve 1 cup mashed potatoes; discard remainder
In a large saucepan, saute onion, green and red bell pepper and celery in butter over medium high heat until tender
Turn heat to low and fold in flaked fish
Slowly mix in flour, cheese,   seasoning, dry mustard, salt, pepper, mashed potatoes and milk
With floured hands shape batter into cakes 1/2 inch by 3 inches
If you are baking the fish cakes bake them for 10 minutes, flip the cakes and bake another 15 minutes until golden brown
